candidates.definition: Measuring devices that display temporal or motion-related quantities like time, speed, distance, or rotational rate.

positive_examples: The dashboard clock showed it was nearly midnight.
She glanced at the speedometer to check she wasn't exceeding the limit.
The mechanic watched the tachometer to monitor engine RPMs.
After the road trip, the odometer read 50,000 miles.
The pilot checked both the airspeed indicator and the flight timer.
His watch displayed the exact time while the car's speedometer showed 65 mph.
negative_examples: The thermometer showed the temperature was rising.
She used a ruler to measure the length of the table.
The pressure gauge indicated the tire needed more air.
He weighed himself on the bathroom scale.
The voltmeter displayed the electrical current reading.
The fuel gauge showed the tank was nearly empty.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Thermometer, Scale, PressureGauge, Ruler

candidates.definition: Instruments that measure atmospheric pressure, vacuum levels, or pressure-related altitude changes.

positive_examples: The pilot checked the altimeter before takeoff to verify the aircraft's altitude.
The barometer reading indicated a drop in atmospheric pressure, suggesting incoming weather.
The vacuum gauge showed the system had achieved the required negative pressure level.
Weather forecasters rely on pressure measurements to predict storm systems.
The mountaineer's altimeter displayed their current elevation above sea level.
Laboratory technicians monitored the vacuum chamber using a specialized pressure gauge.
negative_examples: The thermometer showed the temperature had dropped to freezing.
She used a ruler to measure the length of the table.
The speedometer indicated the car was traveling at 65 mph.
The scale showed he had lost five pounds this month.
The voltmeter measured the electrical current flowing through the circuit.
The compass pointed north to help them navigate through the forest.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Thermometers, Speedometers, WeighingScales, ElectricalMeters

candidates.definition: Instruments that measure physical or chemical properties of the surrounding environment or atmospheric conditions.

positive_examples: The thermometer showed the room temperature had dropped to 65 degrees.
The car's oxygen sensor detected a lean fuel mixture in the exhaust.
We used a hydrometer to test the specific gravity of the battery acid.
The mass airflow sensor measures how much air enters the engine.
The bimetallic strip in the thermostat curled as the temperature changed.
Environmental monitoring stations use various sensors to track air quality.
negative_examples: The scale showed she had lost five pounds this week.
The speedometer indicated we were traveling at 55 mph.
He used a ruler to measure the length of the board.
The pressure gauge on the tire read 32 PSI.
The voltmeter displayed the battery's electrical output.
The GPS device calculated our exact coordinates.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: WeightScales, SpeedMeters, PressureGauges, ElectricalMeters, DistanceMeasuringTools

candidates.definition: Diagnostic procedures or tools used to assess health conditions, detect diseases, or evaluate bodily functions.

positive_examples: The doctor ordered a blood test to check for diabetes.
She failed the eye exam and needed new glasses.
The COVID-19 rapid test came back negative.
The PCR test confirmed the presence of the virus.
He had to take a vision test to renew his driver's license.
The antibody test showed she had been exposed to the disease.
negative_examples: The thermometer showed his temperature was normal.
She used a scale to weigh herself every morning.
The pH meter indicated the water was too acidic.
He checked his blood pressure with the cuff monitor.
The teacher graded the math quiz yesterday.
The driving test required parallel parking skills.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Thermometers, Scales, Gauges, Meters, Rulers

candidates.definition: Physical instruments that directly measure dimensions, weight, or gaps through contact or mechanical comparison.

positive_examples: She used a ruler to measure the length of the wooden board.
The kitchen scale showed that the flour weighed exactly two pounds.
The mechanic inserted feeler gauges to check the spark plug gap.
He placed the metal strip on the bathroom scale to weigh it.
The carpenter's measuring stick indicated the beam was twelve feet long.
Using calipers, she measured the thickness of the copper wire.
negative_examples: The digital thermometer displayed the room temperature as 72 degrees.
She checked her blood pressure using the electronic monitor.
The GPS device calculated their exact coordinates on the map.
The speedometer showed the car was traveling at 65 mph.
He used a stopwatch to time the runner's lap around the track.
The voltmeter indicated the battery had sufficient charge.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DigitalSensors, Thermometers, Timers, ElectricalMeters, Gauges
